newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan's Idemitsu sees stable crude prices.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Idemitsu sees stable crude prices.

text.p: Japanese refiner Idemitsu Kosan Co Ltd said on Tuesday it expects global crude oil prices to remain stable in the short term after recent volatility.
Yasuyuki Yoshida, senior managing director of Idemitsu Kosan, told reporters he expected Dubai crude to remain steady at current levels of $16.50 per barrel.
"It is unlikely crude prices will fall sharply in the short term," he said.
Dubai dipped to nearly $16.00 in the first week of April, down sharply compared to levels of over $22.00 in January.
U.S. gasoline demand was likely to be the key to crude market direction in the coming months, Yoshida said.
May Dubai was assessed at $16.55/16.65 on Tuesday in Asia.
